text:
Hi Guys,

I am quite stucked with an issue. I am working on HubSpot form. I created a multi step form.
First form has email address but second doesnot have. Maybe because of that I couldnt see second form
submissions in contacts submission details.I thought of adding hidden email field in second form and populate with
email value from first form. I captured the value based on onFormSubmit event. I can see the value correctly in the
variable like this: email=$("input[name=email]").val();

Inorder to set that value to second form , I tried $("input[name=email]").val(email).change() ; on second forms
submission code.On console.log I can see the email address correctly but it is not creating submissions if i check in that contact submissions.

I tried Autoprepopulate using query string. But that doesnt work as both my forms are in same page.From my understanding,
in order to enable that feature, you should provide a link to user with the parameters, in this case email.

Does anyone knows a solution for this.
<@UHPS3D5J9>, update the subsequent formsâ€™ hidden fields on submission of the first

thanks <@U3T21PDBK> it worked when I changed the value on submission of first form. May I know why it didn't worked when give it on second form submit....as the field was hidden I thought passing the email on second forms submit will also pass data correctly?
